trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Upgrade from Windows Azure AD sync tool (DirSync) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Upgrade from Windows Azure AD sync tool (DirSync) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to upgrade from DirSync to Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to upgrade from DirSync to Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: This articles describes the steps for upgrading your current Windows Azure AD sync tool (DirSync) to Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: This articles describes the steps for upgrading your current Windows Azure AD sync tool (DirSync) to Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Upgrading Windows Azure Active Directory sync (DirSync) to Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Upgrading Windows Azure Active Directory sync (DirSync) to Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: The following documentation will help you upgrade your existing DirSync installation to Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: The following documentation will help you upgrade your existing DirSync installation to Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Related documentation
trans-unit.target: Related documentation

trans-unit.source: If you did not read the documentation on [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md), the following table provides links to related topics.
trans-unit.target: If you did not read the documentation on [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md), the following table provides links to related topics.

trans-unit.source: The first two topics in bold are required before you start the upgrade from DirSync.
trans-unit.target: The first two topics in bold are required before you start the upgrade from DirSync.

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Download Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Download Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Download Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Download Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Hardware and prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Hardware and prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect: Hardware and prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect: Hardware and prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Accounts used for installation
trans-unit.target: Accounts used for installation

trans-unit.source: More about Azure AD Connect accounts and permissions
trans-unit.target: More about Azure AD Connect accounts and permissions

trans-unit.source: Upgrade from DirSync
trans-unit.target: Upgrade from DirSync

trans-unit.source: Depending on your current DirSync deployment there are different options for the upgrade.
trans-unit.target: Depending on your current DirSync deployment there are different options for the upgrade.

trans-unit.source: If the expected upgrade time is less than 3 hours then we recommend to do an in-place upgrade.
trans-unit.target: If the expected upgrade time is less than 3 hours then we recommend to do an in-place upgrade.

trans-unit.source: If the expected upgrade time is more than 3 hours we recommend to do a parallel deployment on another server.
trans-unit.target: If the expected upgrade time is more than 3 hours we recommend to do a parallel deployment on another server.

trans-unit.source: It is estimated that if you have more than 50,000 objects it will take more than 3 hours to do the upgrade.
trans-unit.target: It is estimated that if you have more than 50,000 objects it will take more than 3 hours to do the upgrade.

trans-unit.source: Scenario
trans-unit.target: Scenario

trans-unit.source: In-place upgrade
trans-unit.target: In-place upgrade

trans-unit.source: Preferred option if the upgrade is expected to take less than 3 hours.
trans-unit.target: Preferred option if the upgrade is expected to take less than 3 hours.

trans-unit.source: Parallel deployment
trans-unit.target: Parallel deployment

trans-unit.source: Preferred option if the upgrade is expected to take more than 3 hours.
trans-unit.target: Preferred option if the upgrade is expected to take more than 3 hours.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you plan to upgrade from DirSync to Azure AD Connect, do not uninstall DirSync yourself before the upgrade.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When you plan to upgrade from DirSync to Azure AD Connect, do not uninstall DirSync yourself before the upgrade.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect will read and migrate the configuration from DirSync and uninstall after inspecting the server.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect will read and migrate the configuration from DirSync and uninstall after inspecting the server.

trans-unit.source: In-place upgrade
trans-unit.target: In-place upgrade

trans-unit.source: The expected time to complete the upgrade is displayed by the wizard.
trans-unit.target: The expected time to complete the upgrade is displayed by the wizard.

trans-unit.source: This estimate is based on the assumption it will take 3 hours to complete an upgrade for a database with 50,000 objects (users, contacts, and groups).
trans-unit.target: This estimate is based on the assumption it will take 3 hours to complete an upgrade for a database with 50,000 objects (users, contacts, and groups).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect will analyze your current DirSync settings and recommend an in-place upgrade if the number of objects in your database is less than 50,000.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect will analyze your current DirSync settings and recommend an in-place upgrade if the number of objects in your database is less than 50,000.

trans-unit.source: If you decide to continue, your current settings will be automatically applied during upgrade and your server will automatically resume active synchronization.
trans-unit.target: If you decide to continue, your current settings will be automatically applied during upgrade and your server will automatically resume active synchronization.

trans-unit.source: If you want to do a configuration migration and do a parallel deployment you can override the in-place upgrade recommendation.
trans-unit.target: If you want to do a configuration migration and do a parallel deployment you can override the in-place upgrade recommendation.

trans-unit.source: You might for example take the opportunity to refresh the hardware and operating system.
trans-unit.target: You might for example take the opportunity to refresh the hardware and operating system.

trans-unit.source: See the [parallel deployment](#parallel-deployment) section for more information.
trans-unit.target: See the [parallel deployment](#parallel-deployment) section for more information.

trans-unit.source: Parallel deployment
trans-unit.target: Parallel deployment

trans-unit.source: Using a parallel deployment is recommended if you have more than 50,000 objects.
trans-unit.target: Using a parallel deployment is recommended if you have more than 50,000 objects.

trans-unit.source: This will avoid any operational delays experienced by your users.
trans-unit.target: This will avoid any operational delays experienced by your users.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Connect installation will attempt to estimate the downtime for the upgrade, but if you've upgraded DirSync in the past, your own experience is likely to be the best guide.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Connect installation will attempt to estimate the downtime for the upgrade, but if you've upgraded DirSync in the past, your own experience is likely to be the best guide.

trans-unit.source: Supported DirSync configurations to be upgraded
trans-unit.target: Supported DirSync configurations to be upgraded

trans-unit.source: The following configuration changes are supported with DirSync and will be upgraded:
trans-unit.target: The following configuration changes are supported with DirSync and will be upgraded:

trans-unit.source: Domain and OU filtering
trans-unit.target: Domain and OU filtering

trans-unit.source: Alternate ID (UPN)
trans-unit.target: Alternate ID (UPN)

trans-unit.source: Password sync and Exchange hybrid settings
trans-unit.target: Password sync and Exchange hybrid settings

trans-unit.source: Your forest/domain and Azure AD settings
trans-unit.target: Your forest/domain and Azure AD settings

trans-unit.source: Filtering based on user attributes
trans-unit.target: Filtering based on user attributes

trans-unit.source: The following changes cannot be upgraded.
trans-unit.target: The following changes cannot be upgraded.

trans-unit.source: If you have made any of these changes the upgrade will be blocked.
trans-unit.target: If you have made any of these changes the upgrade will be blocked.

trans-unit.source: Upgrade blocked
trans-unit.target: Upgrade blocked

trans-unit.source: In those cases the recommendation is to install a new Azure AD Connect server in [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode) and verify the old DirSync and new Azure AD Connect configuration.
trans-unit.target: In those cases the recommendation is to install a new Azure AD Connect server in [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode) and verify the old DirSync and new Azure AD Connect configuration.

trans-unit.source: Reapply any changes using custom configuration, as described in [Azure AD Connect Sync custom configuration](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md).
trans-unit.target: Reapply any changes using custom configuration, as described in [Azure AD Connect Sync custom configuration](active-directory-aadconnectsync-whatis.md).

trans-unit.source: Unsupported DirSync changes, e.g. removed attributes and using a custom extension DLL
trans-unit.target: Unsupported DirSync changes, e.g. removed attributes and using a custom extension DLL

trans-unit.source: The passwords used by DirSync for the service accounts cannot be retrieved and will not be migrated.
trans-unit.target: The passwords used by DirSync for the service accounts cannot be retrieved and will not be migrated.

trans-unit.source: These passwords will be reset during the upgrade.
trans-unit.target: These passwords will be reset during the upgrade.

trans-unit.source: High-level steps for upgrading from DirSync to Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: High-level steps for upgrading from DirSync to Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Welcome to Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Welcome to Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Analysis of current DirSync configuration
trans-unit.target: Analysis of current DirSync configuration

trans-unit.source: Collect Azure AD global admin password
trans-unit.target: Collect Azure AD global admin password

trans-unit.source: Collect credentials for an enterprise admin account (only used during the installation of Azure AD Connect)
trans-unit.target: Collect credentials for an enterprise admin account (only used during the installation of Azure AD Connect)

trans-unit.source: Installation of Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Installation of Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Uninstall DirSync
trans-unit.target: Uninstall DirSync

trans-unit.source: Install Azure AD Connect
trans-unit.target: Install Azure AD Connect

trans-unit.source: Optionally begin synchronization
trans-unit.target: Optionally begin synchronization

trans-unit.source: Additional steps are required when:
trans-unit.target: Additional steps are required when:

trans-unit.source: You're currently using Full SQL Server - local or remote
trans-unit.target: You're currently using Full SQL Server - local or remote

trans-unit.source: You have more than 50,000 objects in scope for synchronization
trans-unit.target: You have more than 50,000 objects in scope for synchronization

trans-unit.source: In-place upgrade
trans-unit.target: In-place upgrade

trans-unit.source: Launch the Azure AD Connect installer (MSI).
trans-unit.target: Launch the Azure AD Connect installer (MSI).

trans-unit.source: Review and agree to license terms and privacy notice.
trans-unit.target: Review and agree to license terms and privacy notice.

trans-unit.source: Welcome to Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Welcome to Azure AD

trans-unit.source: Click next to begin analysis of your existing DirSync installation.
trans-unit.target: Click next to begin analysis of your existing DirSync installation.

trans-unit.source: Analyzing existing Directory Sync installation
trans-unit.target: Analyzing existing Directory Sync installation

trans-unit.source: When the analysis completes, we will make recommendations on how to proceed.
trans-unit.target: When the analysis completes, we will make recommendations on how to proceed.

trans-unit.source: If you use SQL Server Express and have less than 50,000 objects, the following screen is shown:
trans-unit.target: If you use SQL Server Express and have less than 50,000 objects, the following screen is shown:

trans-unit.source: Analysis completed ready to upgrade from DirSync
trans-unit.target: Analysis completed ready to upgrade from DirSync

trans-unit.source: If you use a full SQL Server for DirSync you will see this page instead:
trans-unit.target: If you use a full SQL Server for DirSync you will see this page instead:

trans-unit.source: ![Analysis completed ready to upgrade from DirSync](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started/AnalysisReadyFullSQL.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Analysis completed ready to upgrade from DirSync](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started/AnalysisReadyFullSQL.png)

trans-unit.source: The information regarding the existing SQL Server database server being used by DirSync is displayed.
trans-unit.target: The information regarding the existing SQL Server database server being used by DirSync is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Make appropriate adjustments if needed.
trans-unit.target: Make appropriate adjustments if needed.

trans-unit.source: Click **Next** to continue the installation.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next** to continue the installation.

trans-unit.source: If you have more than 50,000 objects you will see this screen instead:
trans-unit.target: If you have more than 50,000 objects you will see this screen instead:

trans-unit.source: ![Analysis completed ready to upgrade from DirSync](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started/AnalysisRecommendParallel.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Analysis completed ready to upgrade from DirSync](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started/AnalysisRecommendParallel.png)

trans-unit.source: To proceed with an in-place upgrade, click the checkbox next to this message: **Continue upgrading DirSync on this computer.**
trans-unit.target: To proceed with an in-place upgrade, click the checkbox next to this message: **Continue upgrading DirSync on this computer.**

trans-unit.source: To do a [parallel deployment](#parallel-deployment) instead you will export the DirSync configuration settings and move those to the new server.
trans-unit.target: To do a [parallel deployment](#parallel-deployment) instead you will export the DirSync configuration settings and move those to the new server.

trans-unit.source: Provide the password for the account you currently use to connect to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Provide the password for the account you currently use to connect to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: This must be the account currently used by DirSync.
trans-unit.target: This must be the account currently used by DirSync.

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: Provide an enterprise admin account for Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Provide an enterprise admin account for Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Enter your ADDS credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your ADDS credentials

trans-unit.source: You're now ready to configure.
trans-unit.target: You're now ready to configure.

trans-unit.source: When you click **Upgrade**, DirSync will be uninstalled and Azure AD Connect will be configured and begin synchronizing.
trans-unit.target: When you click **Upgrade**, DirSync will be uninstalled and Azure AD Connect will be configured and begin synchronizing.

trans-unit.source: ![Ready to configure](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started/ReadyToConfigure.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Ready to configure](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started/ReadyToConfigure.png)

trans-unit.source: Parallel deployment
trans-unit.target: Parallel deployment

trans-unit.source: Export the DirSync configuration
trans-unit.target: Export the DirSync configuration

trans-unit.source: Parallel deployment with more than 50,000 objects
trans-unit.target: Parallel deployment with more than 50,000 objects

trans-unit.source: If you have more than 50,000 objects the Azure AD Connect installation will recommend a parallel deployment.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than 50,000 objects the Azure AD Connect installation will recommend a parallel deployment.

trans-unit.source: A screen similar to the following will be displayed:
trans-unit.target: A screen similar to the following will be displayed:

trans-unit.source: Analysis complete
trans-unit.target: Analysis complete

trans-unit.source: If you want to proceed with parallel deployment you will need to perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: If you want to proceed with parallel deployment you will need to perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Click the **Export settings** button.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Export settings** button.

trans-unit.source: When you install Azure AD Connect on a separate server these settings will be imported to migrate any settings from your current DirSync to your new Azure AD Connect installation.
trans-unit.target: When you install Azure AD Connect on a separate server these settings will be imported to migrate any settings from your current DirSync to your new Azure AD Connect installation.

trans-unit.source: Once your settings have been successfully exported, you can exit the Azure AD Connect wizard on the DirSync server.
trans-unit.target: Once your settings have been successfully exported, you can exit the Azure AD Connect wizard on the DirSync server.

trans-unit.source: Continue with the next step to [install Azure AD Connect on a separate server](#installation-of-azure-ad-connect-on-separate-server)
trans-unit.target: Continue with the next step to [install Azure AD Connect on a separate server](#installation-of-azure-ad-connect-on-separate-server)

trans-unit.source: Parallel deployment with less than 50,000 objects
trans-unit.target: Parallel deployment with less than 50,000 objects

trans-unit.source: If you have less than 50,000 objects but still want to do a parallel deployment, then do the following:
trans-unit.target: If you have less than 50,000 objects but still want to do a parallel deployment, then do the following:

trans-unit.source: Run the Azure AD Connect installer (MSI).
trans-unit.target: Run the Azure AD Connect installer (MSI).

trans-unit.source: When you see the **Welcome to Azure AD Connect** screen, exit the installation wizard by clicking the "X" in the top right corner of the window.
trans-unit.target: When you see the **Welcome to Azure AD Connect** screen, exit the installation wizard by clicking the "X" in the top right corner of the window.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt.

trans-unit.source: From the install location of Azure AD Connect (Default: C:\Program Files\Microsoft Azure Active Directory Connect) execute the following command:
trans-unit.target: From the install location of Azure AD Connect (Default: C:\Program Files\Microsoft Azure Active Directory Connect) execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: `AzureADConnect.exe /ForceExport`.
trans-unit.target: `AzureADConnect.exe /ForceExport`.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Export settings** button.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Export settings** button.

trans-unit.source: When you install Azure AD Connect on a separate server these settings will be imported to migrate any settings from your current DirSync to your new Azure AD Connect installation.
trans-unit.target: When you install Azure AD Connect on a separate server these settings will be imported to migrate any settings from your current DirSync to your new Azure AD Connect installation.

trans-unit.source: Analysis complete
trans-unit.target: Analysis complete

trans-unit.source: Once your settings have been successfully exported, you can exit the Azure AD Connect wizard on the DirSync server.
trans-unit.target: Once your settings have been successfully exported, you can exit the Azure AD Connect wizard on the DirSync server.

trans-unit.source: Continue with the next step to [install Azure AD Connect on a separate server](#installation-of-azure-ad-connect-on-separate-server)
trans-unit.target: Continue with the next step to [install Azure AD Connect on a separate server](#installation-of-azure-ad-connect-on-separate-server)

trans-unit.source: Install Azure AD Connect on separate server
trans-unit.target: Install Azure AD Connect on separate server

trans-unit.source: When you install Azure AD Connect on a new server it will assume that you want to perform a clean install of Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: When you install Azure AD Connect on a new server it will assume that you want to perform a clean install of Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: Since you want to use the DirSync configuration there are some extra steps to take:
trans-unit.target: Since you want to use the DirSync configuration there are some extra steps to take:

trans-unit.source: Run the Azure AD Connect installer (MSI).
trans-unit.target: Run the Azure AD Connect installer (MSI).

trans-unit.source: When you see the **Welcome to Azure AD Connect** screen, exit the installation wizard by clicking the "X" in the top right corner of the window.
trans-unit.target: When you see the **Welcome to Azure AD Connect** screen, exit the installation wizard by clicking the "X" in the top right corner of the window.

trans-unit.source: Open a command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Open a command prompt.

trans-unit.source: From the install location of Azure AD Connect (Default: C:\Program Files\Microsoft Azure Active Directory Connect) execute the following command:
trans-unit.target: From the install location of Azure AD Connect (Default: C:\Program Files\Microsoft Azure Active Directory Connect) execute the following command:

trans-unit.source: `AzureADConnect.exe /migrate`.
trans-unit.target: `AzureADConnect.exe /migrate`.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD Connect installation wizard starts and presents you with the following screen:
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD Connect installation wizard starts and presents you with the following screen:

trans-unit.source: ![Enter your Azure AD credentials](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started/ImportSettings.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Enter your Azure AD credentials](./media/active-directory-aadconnect-dirsync-upgrade-get-started/ImportSettings.png)

trans-unit.source: Select the settings file that exported from your DirSync installation.
trans-unit.target: Select the settings file that exported from your DirSync installation.

trans-unit.source: Configure any advanced options including:
trans-unit.target: Configure any advanced options including:

trans-unit.source: A custom installation location for Azure AD Connect.
trans-unit.target: A custom installation location for Azure AD Connect.

trans-unit.source: An existing instance of SQL Server (Default: Azure AD Connect installs SQL Server 2012 Express).
trans-unit.target: An existing instance of SQL Server (Default: Azure AD Connect installs SQL Server 2012 Express).

trans-unit.source: Do not use the same database instance as your DirSync server.
trans-unit.target: Do not use the same database instance as your DirSync server.

trans-unit.source: A service account used to connect to SQL Server (If your SQL Server database is remote then this account must be a domain service account).
trans-unit.target: A service account used to connect to SQL Server (If your SQL Server database is remote then this account must be a domain service account).

trans-unit.source: These options can be seen on this screen:
trans-unit.target: These options can be seen on this screen:

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: Click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Ready to configure** page, leave the **Start the synchronization process as soon as the configuration completes** checked.
trans-unit.target: On the **Ready to configure** page, leave the **Start the synchronization process as soon as the configuration completes** checked.

trans-unit.source: The server will be in [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode) so changes will not be exported to Azure AD at this time.
trans-unit.target: The server will be in [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode) so changes will not be exported to Azure AD at this time.

trans-unit.source: Click **Install**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Install**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Synchronization between Windows Server Active Directory and Azure Active Directory will begin, but no changes will be exported to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Synchronization between Windows Server Active Directory and Azure Active Directory will begin, but no changes will be exported to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Only one synchronization tool can be actively exporting changes at a time.
trans-unit.target: Only one synchronization tool can be actively exporting changes at a time.

trans-unit.source: This is called [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode).
trans-unit.target: This is called [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode).

trans-unit.source: Verify that Azure AD Connect is ready to begin synchronization
trans-unit.target: Verify that Azure AD Connect is ready to begin synchronization

trans-unit.source: In order to verify that Azure AD Connect is ready to take over from DirSync you will need to open **Synchronization Service Manager** in the group **Azure AD Connect** from the start menu.
trans-unit.target: In order to verify that Azure AD Connect is ready to take over from DirSync you will need to open **Synchronization Service Manager** in the group **Azure AD Connect** from the start menu.

trans-unit.source: Within the application you will need to view the **Operations** tab.
trans-unit.target: Within the application you will need to view the **Operations** tab.

trans-unit.source: On this tab you are looking to confirm that the following operations have been completed:
trans-unit.target: On this tab you are looking to confirm that the following operations have been completed:

trans-unit.source: Import on the AD Connector
trans-unit.target: Import on the AD Connector

trans-unit.source: Import on the Azure AD Connector
trans-unit.target: Import on the Azure AD Connector

trans-unit.source: Full Sync on the AD Connector
trans-unit.target: Full Sync on the AD Connector

trans-unit.source: Full Sync on the Azure AD Connector
trans-unit.target: Full Sync on the Azure AD Connector

trans-unit.source: Import and Sync Completed
trans-unit.target: Import and Sync Completed

trans-unit.source: Review the result from these operations and ensure there are no errors.
trans-unit.target: Review the result from these operations and ensure there are no errors.

trans-unit.source: If you want to see and inspect which changes are about to be exported to Azure AD, then read how to verify the configuration under [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode).
trans-unit.target: If you want to see and inspect which changes are about to be exported to Azure AD, then read how to verify the configuration under [staging mode](active-directory-aadconnectsync-operations.md#staging-mode).

trans-unit.source: Make required configuration changes until you do not see anything unexpected.
trans-unit.target: Make required configuration changes until you do not see anything unexpected.

trans-unit.source: Once these 4 operations have been completed, there are no errors, and you are satisfied with the changes which are about to be exported, you are ready to uninstall DirSync and enable Azure AD Connect synchronization.
trans-unit.target: Once these 4 operations have been completed, there are no errors, and you are satisfied with the changes which are about to be exported, you are ready to uninstall DirSync and enable Azure AD Connect synchronization.

trans-unit.source: Complete the next two steps to complete the migration.
trans-unit.target: Complete the next two steps to complete the migration.

trans-unit.source: Uninstall DirSync (old server)
trans-unit.target: Uninstall DirSync (old server)

trans-unit.source: From **Programs and features** locate **Windows Azure Active Directory sync tool**
trans-unit.target: From **Programs and features** locate **Windows Azure Active Directory sync tool**

trans-unit.source: Uninstall **Windows Azure Active Directory sync tool**
trans-unit.target: Uninstall **Windows Azure Active Directory sync tool**

trans-unit.source: Note that the uninstallation might take up to 15 minutes to complete.
trans-unit.target: Note that the uninstallation might take up to 15 minutes to complete.

trans-unit.source: With DirSync uninstalled, there is no active server exporting to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: With DirSync uninstalled, there is no active server exporting to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: The next step must be completed before any changes in your on-premises Active Directory will continue to be synchronized to Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The next step must be completed before any changes in your on-premises Active Directory will continue to be synchronized to Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Enable Azure AD Connect (new server)
trans-unit.target: Enable Azure AD Connect (new server)

trans-unit.source: After installation, re-opening Azure AD connect will allow you to make additional configuration changes.
trans-unit.target: After installation, re-opening Azure AD connect will allow you to make additional configuration changes.

trans-unit.source: Start **Azure AD Connect** from the start menu or from the shortcut on the desktop.
trans-unit.target: Start **Azure AD Connect** from the start menu or from the shortcut on the desktop.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you do not try to run the installation MSI again.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you do not try to run the installation MSI again.

trans-unit.source: You should see the following:
trans-unit.target: You should see the following:

trans-unit.source: Additional tasks
trans-unit.target: Additional tasks

trans-unit.source: Select **Configure staging mode**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Configure staging mode**.

trans-unit.source: Turn off staging by unchecking the **Enabled staging mode** checkbox.
trans-unit.target: Turn off staging by unchecking the **Enabled staging mode** checkbox.

trans-unit.source: Enter your Azure AD credentials
trans-unit.target: Enter your Azure AD credentials

trans-unit.source: Click the **Next** button
trans-unit.target: Click the **Next** button

trans-unit.source: On the confirmation page, click on the **install** button.
trans-unit.target: On the confirmation page, click on the **install** button.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Connect is now your active server.
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Connect is now your active server.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have Azure AD Connect installed you can [verify the installation and assign licenses](active-directory-aadconnect-whats-next.md).
trans-unit.target: Now that you have Azure AD Connect installed you can [verify the installation and assign licenses](active-directory-aadconnect-whats-next.md).

trans-unit.source: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
trans-unit.target: Learn more about [Integrating your on-premises identities with Azure Active Directory](active-directory-aadconnect.md).
